files.description: Defines the canonical repository layout and a deterministic set of move/merge rules for integrating agent output directories into the real repo.
Implements a reproducible integration tool that applies the integration_map.yml rules to move/merge agent-generated outputs into the canonical repository tree with safety checks and a dry-run mode.
GitHub Actions CI workflow that runs on a clean environment, installs pinned dependencies, and executes linting/formatting checks plus the test suite.
Pre-commit configuration mirroring the intended CI checks to ensure consistent local and CI lint/format behavior.
Pinned runtime Python dependencies used by CI and users to ensure deterministic installs on clean environments.
Pinned development and CI-only Python dependencies (linters, formatters, test tools) to keep CI deterministic and minimal.
Minimal release checklist documenting exactly how to prepare and tag v0.1, including CI verification steps and Git tag commands.

missionDescription: Integrate the agent-generated outputs into a single canonical repository layout (move/merge from code-creation output directories into the real repo), then verify GitHub Actions CI (ci.yml) runs successfully on a clean environment with pinned dependencies; produce a minimal RELEASE/CHECKLIST.md describing how to tag v0.1.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker
Current artifacts appear fragmented across agent output paths; without consolidation into the true repo structure and verified CI, the project cannot be reliably reproduced or extended.
